Key Match Events: Dilshan Madushanka took a double-wicket maiden early in the Australia chase
Mitchell Marsh scored a half-century off 39 balls
Josh Inglis and Mitchell Marsh put on a 77-run stand
Pathum Nissanka scored 61 runs from 67 balls
Kusal Perera scored 78 runs from 82 balls
David Warner took an exceptional catch to dismiss Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka was ruled out of the tournament due to an injury
Sri Lanka elected to bat first
Post-Match Reflections: The victory sees Australia improve to eighth on the World Cup standings
Sri Lanka remain winless and have a mountain of work to do to stay in contention for a semi-final berth
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia's bowlers and batters kickstarted their ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 campaign with a five-wicket win over Sri Lanka
The Asian side were restricted late in their innings due to some inspired bowling from Adam Zampa, Mitchell Starc, and Pat Cummins backed up with good catching in the field
Others: The match was played in Lucknow
The match was a part of the ICC Cricket World Cup, 2023
The match was a league match between Australia and Sri Lanka
